New Commemorative Stamp Issued
   Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA)--A new commemorative stamp (a kind of souvenir sheet) has been published in the DPRK on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War (July 27).
 Reflected on the souvenir sheet are a painting showing Hero Ri Su Bok rushing toward an enemy's pillbox to cover it, his photograph and a medal of Hero of the DPRK. Also seen there is the song "For the Motherland" based on the poem written by him.    
 Ri Su Bok silenced the enemy's gun muzzle with his body to ensure the victory of his unit at the Height 1,211 battle at the age of 18 during the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25,1950-July 27,1953). He is still alive in the minds of the Korean people.

DPRK Delegation Leaves for Malaysia
   Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs, left here Tuesday to attend the 13th ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum to be held in Kuala Lumpur.
 The delegation will visit Malaysia and Singapore.    
 It was sent off at the airport by Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and Sarizam Bin Abu Bakar, charge d' affaires a.i. of Malaysia.
